TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit KeyContainerPermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission implements class System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission

Docs.summary: Controls the ability to access key containers. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This permission is used to provide limited access to key containers.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with either restricted or unrestricted permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Creates either `None` (fully restricted) or `Unrestricted` access to key containers.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of objects associated with the current permission.
Docs.value: A containing the objects for this .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Each <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionAccessEntry> object in the collection specifies the access rights for a specific key container.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Copy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission.
Docs.returns: A copy of the current permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A copy of the permission represents the same access to resources as the original permission.

Docs.summary: Gets the key container permission flags that apply to all key containers associated with the permission.
Docs.value: A bitwise combination of the values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Flags property is set by the constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void FromXml(class System.Security.SecurityElement securityElement) cil managed

Docs.param: A that contains the XML encoding used to reconstruct the permission.
Docs.summary: Reconstructs a permission with a specified state from an XML encoding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The FromXml method reconstructs a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermission> object from an XML encoding defined by the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class. Use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermission.ToXml%2A> method to XML-encode the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermission>, including state information.

Docs.exception:
is not a valid permission element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Intersect(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission to intersect with the current permission. It must be the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: A new permission that represents the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission. This new permission is if the intersection is empty.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the set of operations they both describe in common. Only a demand that passes both individual permissions will pass the intersection.

Docs.exception: is not and does not specify a permission of the same type as the current permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission to test for the subset relationship. This permission must be the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
Docs.returns: if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The current permission is a subset of the specified permission if the current permission specifies a set of operations that is wholly contained in the specified permission. For example, a permission for <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags> access is a subset of a permission for <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags> access.

Docs.exception: is not and does not specify a permission of the same type as the current permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsUnrestricted() cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines whether the current permission is unrestricted.
Docs.returns: if the current permission is unrestricted; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks An unrestricted permission represents access to all resources protected by the permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.SecurityElement ToXml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an XML encoding of the permission and its current state.
Docs.returns: A that contains an XML encoding of the permission, including state information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermission.FromXml%2A> method to restore the state information from a <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Union(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission to combine with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The result of a call to Union is a permission that represents all operations represented by both the current permission and the specified permission. Any demand that passes either permission passes their union.

Docs.exception: is not and does not specify a permission of the same type as the current permission.
